Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_RL3}Helmgart
Settlement.text: {=!}At the head of the Axe Bite pass sits the town of Helmgart. Ruled by Margrave Reinhardt von Mackensen, the fortress town serves as both the economic and military border between Bretonnia and the Empire. Axe Bite is one of three mountain passes through the Grey mountains; as such the safety of passage through it is a primary concern. Helmgart itself is a market town, surrounded by several curtain walls. One of these walls traverses the entire width of the pass itself, meaning all travel must pass through its single gate or be stuck on either the Bretonnian or Imperial side of the border.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL3_1}Ussingen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL3_1}Ussingen is a small village located on the road between Holthusen and Osburg. The town is at the furthest point that the River Schilder remains navigable by barge, meaning that many shipments bound for Helmgart will arrive first here. The people here raise crops along the river Schilder and will venture into the nearby Grey Mountains to mine seams of ore. The town is well protected by the walls at Helmgart, and really only worries about the denizens of the Reikwald.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL3_2}Morlenfurt
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_RL4}Bögenhafen
Settlement.text: {=!}Bögenhafen is a prominent market town that sits on either side of the River Bögen. It is midway between Altdorf and Montfort allowing the town to maintain its economic importance through nearly any hardship. The northside of the town, known as the Pit, is the smallest and poorest section of Bögenhafen. The Southside of the town is where most of the wealth and all of the town’s important institutions reside, including its religious temples and town hall. A town council rules in the name of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL4_1}Osburg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL4_1}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. Any shipments bound for Helmgart must pass first through Osburg, and this source of trade makes the merchants here fairly prosperous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL4_2}Herzhald
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL4_2}To the north northwest of Bögenhafen is the timber producing village of Herzhald. Situated deep in the Reikwald, Herzhald is known for the quality and lengths of its timber samples, much of which is sent to Bögenhafen and Grünburg for their boatbuilding.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_RL5}Ubersreik
Settlement.text: {=!}Ubersreik is one of the most important trade centers in Reikland. It sits astride and important bridge on the road from from Bögenhafen to Dunkelburg. Trade flows along the road as well as downriver to Auerswald, Grünburg, Kemperbad, and Altdorf. In addition, because it is located near Grey Lady Pass, Ubersreik is the ideal location for merchants travelling over the Grey Mountains to move their wares from the river to overland transportation, and vice versa.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL5_1}Greissbach
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL5_1}Geissbach is a forest village just north of Ubersreik. The people here carefully timber the woods nearby and grow what crops they can in the clearings around the village. For a long time there have been rumors and worries about a dark estate just east of the village, which is said to house great evil.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL5_2}Tallerhof
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL1_2}Tallerhof is a small village that sits where the Grey Lady Road meets the Dwarf Road. It astrides the river Teufel and marks the highest place where the river is still navigable by barge. If it were not for the dwarf trade passing through from Karak Azgaraz for Ubersreik, the village would have long been abandoned.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL5_3}Hugeldal
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL5_3}To the south of Ubersreik is the mining town of Hugeldal. Hugeldal was founded three hundred years after the founding of the empire to mine copper and iron from the Grey mountains. In 1112 IC, town records indicate that the Black Plague devastated the local population and nearly ruined the town. The cult of Shallya saw fit to establish a hospice here shortly thereafter. Not long after the arrival of the Shallyans, the Strigany that have always frequented the area were banned from entering the town. Despite this they regularly pitch camp outside of the palisade to entertain and trade with the locals

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_RL6}Dunkelberg
Settlement.text: {=!}On the northern bank of the River Grissen is the market town of Dunkelburg. Dunkelburg benefits from being along the Stimmigen canal, which allows access to many of the market towns in Reikland’s southern region. The town is known for its rustic feel which seems to be preserved in the town despite its continued increase in size. Unfortunately, Dunkelburg’s proximity to the Grey Mountains has doomed it to be plagued by Goblins, who regularly raid the town. One of the results of these raids is that the town has a much higher population of Orphans than many other parts of the Empire. These orphans are provided for by the von Wallensteins however, as long as they work in the town’s several Bleachfields that is.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL6_1}Barfsheim
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL6_1}Barfsheim is a small village along the river Grissen near the Countess Emmanuelle canal. Its grain often is exported out of the Reikland to feed Grissenwald and Nuln.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL6_2}Steindorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL6_2}Steindorf is a small village near the headwaters of the river Grissen. Its people refuse to travel into the Grey Mountains that often overshadow the village. Despite the fact that the minerals would bring great wealth to the village, the people here speak of a dread castle in the mountains above them, saying that they would rather remain in their vale with their grain.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_RL1}Stimmigen
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL1_1}Naffdorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL1_2}Teufelfeuer
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL1_2}Teufelfeuer is a rural village outside of Kemperbad. The village is truly only notable for being the scene where one hundred years ago the forces of the Reikland Clashed with one of the largest hordes of Beastmen to emerge from the Reikwald Forest. The story goes that when the battle wizards through their magical fire towards the monstrosities, the trees around them burst into a devil’s fire with hues not natural to this world. The people here are proud of this story and often hawk the ‘relics’ of this historic battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_RL2}Kemperbad
Settlement.text: {=!}The Grand Freistadt of Kemperbad is a major trade city that sits at the confluences of the rivers Riek and Stir. The city holds a commanding position over this portion of the river trade and is crucial to ensuring the southern empires continued economic prosperity. The city purchased its charter from Emperor Boris the Incompetent in 1066 IC, from then on being ruled directly by the Council of Thirteen which represents the largest merchants in town plus representatives from the local temples of Sigmar and Shallya.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL2_1}Diesdorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL2_1}Diesdorf is a small town on the river Reik located between Altdorf and Kemperbad. Diesdorf is a major holy site of the Cult of Sigmar, it is said that Magnus the Pious once made a powerful and stirring speech to the crowds who had gathered to hear him. Around sixty years ago, Emperor Wilhelm III founded the Diesdorf Military college to train those who have proven their leadership abilities in battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL2_2}Lachenbad
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL2_2}Lachenbad sits along the Tranig river at the joining points of the Grey Lady and Ober-Stimmigen canals. While the village is a farming community, it is the home of a talented blacksmith, Uli and his promisingly talented son Valten.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_RL3}Castle Reiksguard
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Reiksguard is the fortress of the Grand Order of the Reiksguard Knights. It sits on the confluence of the rivers Teufel and Reik. In the time of Emperor Sigismund, while the Reikland was under threat of Gorbad Ironclaw, it was refortified and increased in size by dwarfen architects. It remains a powerful citadel capable of holding hundreds of soldiers and staff and serves as Karl-Franz’s summer home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL3_1}Worlitz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL3_1}Worlitz is a river village protected by the forces garrisoning the Castle Reiksguard. The people here are very loyal directly to the Emperor Karl-Franz who many believe to be a reincarnation of Sigmar. The town benefits from trade heading down the Reik to Altdorf, Marienburg and beyond.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL3_2}Grünburg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL3_2}The town of Grünburg sits on the river Teufel. While trade flows through the town from the canals to itself and from the Reik to its north, Grünburg’s main source of wealth comes from its river boatyards, where many of the boats and barges that ply the rivers of the Reikland originate from. The town is also famous for the Battle of Grünburg where the advance of Orc Warlord Gorbad Ironclaw was finally halted around a half a millenia ago. The battle plains is valued particularly due to the fact that nearly all of the Imperial and orc forces present were mounted calvarymen, unusual for both the contemporary period and the modern era. As such an excavation site has been established by several interested parties and many come to look upon their work.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_RL4}Castle Gauenburg
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Grauenburg is the seat of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim’s rule over the central Reikland and his barony. It is a fortress along the river Bogen that protects Bogenhafen and other nearby locations from attack.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL4_1}Weissbruck
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL4_1}Weissbruck sits on the joining of the Weissbruck Canal and the river Bӧgen. The town once was a major source of coal and iron in the Reikland, the mining of which provided the Gruber family with enough funds to construct the Weissbruck Canal, which enabled easier transportation of the mined material to market. Now the mines have mostly been depleted and while the town continues to have prosperous ventures in trade thanks to the canal, the many former workers of the mine have found themselves unemployed and stuck in Weissbruck, where they spend their time drinking cheap alcohol and causing trouble.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL4_2}Heiligen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL4_2}Just to the south west of altdorf is the small village of Heiligen. The village is nothing to speak of, but it is near the amber hills, which offer a spectacular view of Altdorf from their height.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_RL5}Merxheim
Settlement.text: {=!}The Castle town of Merxheim is the last settlement on the Reik within Imperial borders. Past it either on the river or on the Northwesternly bound road takes one into the Wasteland and Marienburg’s domain. A man here called Karl von Merx has become popular recently for his ideas about the future and human history. Some people call his ideas radical and dangerous, while others see them as the ultimate destiny of the Empire. Regardless, the authorities of the town stand on the brink of throwing him out.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL5_1}Reinsfeld
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL5_1}Reinsfeld is a village along the Uhl river in the northwestern Reikwald. The people here are fairly isolated from the rest of the Province, relying on what little trade passes by on the road towards Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_MO1}Montfort
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the Empire and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the Reikland and the Empire of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the Empire; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO1_1}Jouinard
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO1_1}Frederheim is a small Reiklander village just north of Altdorf on the Altdorf-Middenheim road. While the town is a possession of Karl-Franz and is a part of Altdorf’s demesne, the Emperor has seen fit to give oversight of it in all but name to the Cult of Shallya. This is a result of the cult's request for an area in which to establish a walled hospice and sanatorium.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO1_2}Hachepied
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO1_2}On the eastern side of the confluence of the rivers Taal and Reik sits the village of Kaldach. The town is notable particularly for being the demarcation of the Reikland/Talabecland border. Besides this, it remains a small farming community.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO1_3}Noyers
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_MO2}Poussenc
Settlement.text: {=!}At the Confluence of the River Reik and the River Schilder sits the town of Schilderheim. Ruled by Graf Robert von Uhland, Schilderheim is an important river market down river from altdorf, being one of the last places that trade on the River Reik can stop before reaching Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO2_1}Les Chalesmes
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO2_1}Holthusen is a town in western Reikland on the river Schilder. By road it lies between Eilhart and Schilderheim. The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old World. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO2_2}Sirod
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO2_3}Ardon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO2_3}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_PA2_2}Emilion
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_PA1_2}Teufelfeuer is a rural village outside of Kemperbad. The village is truly only notable for being the scene where one hundred years ago the forces of the Reikland Clashed with one of the largest hordes of Beastmen to emerge from the Reikwald Forest. The story goes that when the battle wizards through their magical fire towards the monstrosities, the trees around them burst into a devil’s fire with hues not natural to this world. The people here are proud of this story and often hawk the ‘relics’ of this historic battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BA1}Castle Bastonne
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the Empire and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the bastonne and the Empire of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the Empire; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BA1_1}Saint-Etienne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_PA2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the bastonnes best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AQ3}Castle Garamont
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of bastonne sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BL1}Castle Bordeleaux
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_BL1}Built upon ancient stonework, the fortress-city of Bordeleaux is perhaps the most important harbour in Bretonnia, rivalled only by Lyon. Castle Bordeleaux sits on a cliff which rises above the harbour, looking over the entire sprawling city and nearby sea traffic. It is said that the engines on its walls, and their skilled engineers, are capable of sinking a moored rowboat without damaging the boats to either side. The city is home to two major holy sites in the realm, the First Chapel of Castle Bordeleaux, the most sacred Grail Chapel in the kingdom; and the Temple of Manaan, of which some say rivals even the temple in Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL2_1}Saint-Junien
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL1_1}Right on the coast of the Great Ocean is the village of Saint Junien. Saint Junien was named after a grail knight who long ago defended the peasants in the area from mysterious sea devils. The peasants here continue to rely on Manaan for their livelihood, though many visitors note that they always seem to have one eye out towards the watery horizon.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL1_2}Aigre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL1_2}Sitting on the road between Tureene and Bordeleaux is Aigre. Aigre is an idyllic place, the peasants here seem content most years and grain normally comes in abundance. Economy: grain

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL1_2}Niort
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL1_3}The area around Niort is famous for its vineyards. The fruit produced here makes a nice red wine, favoured by many nobles all over Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BA1}Turenne
Settlement.text: {=!}The peasant town of Turenne, though lowly, is nothing to scoff at. The people here live under the protection of the duke and while most make their living in the fields around the town, there are those peasants that have taken up a craft or trade near the town square. Turenne is a town dependent on the excesses of Bordeleaux, merchants needing a simple place to stop can often find cheaper rooms and supplies here.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL2_1}Parthenay
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL2_1}Surrounded by rocky crags, the isolated village of Parthenay sits on a hill overlooking the lands of Bordelen and, across the River Grismerie, Mousillon. The people here haul up salt from the beaches below, pack it, and send it to Turenne to their south.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL2_2}Anglet
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL2_2}The people of Anglet pride themselves on breeding some of the best riding stock this side of Massif Orcal. Every year, the peasants round up the various herds, and drive them to market in Bordeleaux.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL2_3}Royan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL2_3}Royan lays in a low and wide gulley, sheltered from the winds that constantly blow across the coastal plains of Bordeleaux. The depression also provides some sanctuary from norscan raiders, who often are unable to see it from the ocean.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BL1}Turris Vigilans
Settlement.text: {=!}De Turris Vigilans, the vigilant tower, is a centre of Verenan worship in Bretonnia. In addition to a large temple, the cult maintains a great lighthouse which is widely considered to be the most reliable in the world. The Priests of Verena here will often offer advice to those that seek their counsel, and are reputable for its benefits. The Cult and the Dukedom of Bordeleaux have the shared interest in watching the cursed land to their north, as a result; the Duke has established a garrison here and the fortifications are always maintained.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL1_1}Daglan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL1_1}Daglan is a small farming village that provides the nearby temple of Verena with most of its foodstuffs. The fruit grown here is known for its hardiness, and can make a decent vintage.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL1_2}Talence
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL1_2}The fish that come down into the brackish waters of the River Grismerie are known for their size and their taste. Really, many local nobles suppose that is the only reason the peasants continue to dwell in Talence, being far too close to the marshes of cursed Mousillon for their liking.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BL1}Castle Saint Jean-de-Luz
Settlement.text: {=!}A small castle, established to watch over the farms and woodlands of east Bordelen. It is named after a long dead noble who stopped an orc warboss from Massif Orcal on the grounds where the castle now sits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL2_1}Belves
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL2_1}In the middle of the rolling plains is the village of Belves. Belves has some of the most.. provincial peasants in Bordeleaux. Their lord rarely comes here, with the yeoman tax collector often being the only visitor to Belves for years at a time.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL2_2}Sare
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL2_2}Sare Saddlebreds are dependable mounts for any knights, yeomen or traveller. The people here pride themselves on producing steads of the highest quality, the result of course is that they only produce a few every season.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BL3}Castle Châtellerault
Settlement.text: {=!}On the edge of the Forest of Châlons sits Castle Châtellerault. Châlons is a dangerous and twisted place; dark trees stand over deep ravines, boulders and chasms. One shouldn't be mistaken, it has its beauties; sweet and cool streams, waterfalls and calm pools dot the undergrowth. It is even said that the true sacred lake of the lady lies somewhere within this forest. With this land, comes the typical predations, greenskins, beastmen and far worse make their homes, and so Châtellerault stands its watch against incursion.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL3_1}Monpazier
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL3_1}Delving into the forest of Châlons for timber, the woodsmen of Monpazier are some of the bravest peasants in all Bordelen. Their daily task brings them almost constantly into contact with beastmen and other foul monstrosities.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL3_2}Limeuil
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL3_2} The peasants of Limeuil venture into the outlying crags of Massif Orcal, looking for sites for clay pits. While they bring back a good amount of clay, they also tell tales of the things they encounter at the foot of the mountains. The local lord has on more than one occasion deemed fit to send men-at-arms into the foothills. What they fought there remains unknown to most.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BA1}Castle Brionne
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the Empire and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the Reikland and the Empire of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the Empire; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BE1_1}Lourdes
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_PA2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BE2_1}Foix
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_PA1_2}Teufelfeuer is a rural village outside of Kemperbad. The village is truly only notable for being the scene where one hundred years ago the forces of the Reikland Clashed with one of the largest hordes of Beastmen to emerge from the Reikwald Forest. The story goes that when the battle wizards through their magical fire towards the monstrosities, the trees around them burst into a devil’s fire with hues not natural to this world. The people here are proud of this story and often hawk the ‘relics’ of this historic battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BE3}Castle Portet castle
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AQ1}Castle Aquitaine
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the vlandia and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the aquitaine and the vlandia of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the vlandia; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AQ1_1}Bayonne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AQ1_1}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the aquitaines best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_CC1}Castle Carcassonne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_CC1}The fortress city and the ducal capital of Carcassonne, Castle Carcassonne sits on an island surrounded by the river Songez. Due to the defensive location Castle Carcassonne is designed to be more of a fortress rather than a city, however there is a small attached town that acts as a marketplace and hub for many travelers and Knights who seek services.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_CC2}Turin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_CC2}Located in the Vaults , the City of Turin is the capital of the Barony of Savoie. The region is influenced heavily by nearby Tilea, despite this the city and people are steadfastly loyal to Bretonnia. Holding the famed relic, the “Shroud of Gilles le Breton” the City of Turin is a Pilgrimage site to all who follow the Lady of the Lake, and all who seek visions of the Lady.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_QU1_1}Perrache
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_PA2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_QU2}Viefin
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the vlandia and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the Reikland and the vlandia of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the vlandia; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_QU1}Castle Beaumarchais
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QUI_3}Merceaux Descloux
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU1_1}Teufelfeuer is a rural village outside of Kemperbad. The village is truly only notable for being the scene where one hundred years ago the forces of the Reikland Clashed with one of the largest hordes of Beastmen to emerge from the Reikwald Forest. The story goes that when the battle wizards through their magical fire towards the monstrosities, the trees around them burst into a devil’s fire with hues not natural to this world. The people here are proud of this story and often hawk the ‘relics’ of this historic battle.
